item.description:
Posted on Behalf of Maine Animal Coalition:

 

MAC's Vegetarian Food Festival is Saturday June 25th! 
 
 
Our Vegetarian Food Festival is Saturday June 25th.  The festival will be held at the East End Community School , 195 North Street, Portland, Maine and run from 11 a.m. to 3 p.m.
 
We have a great group of speakers. Jasmin Singer and Mariann Sullivan of Our Hen House will give two talks. The first is "Food as Activism" and the second is "Writing for Animal Rights." Meg Wolff will speak about her new book A Life in Balance,  Delicous Plant-based Recipies for Optimal Health,  Elizabeth Fraser of Girl Gone Raw will present "Unleash a Vibrant New You with Raw & Living Foods."  Dr. Reuben Bell of Healthy Doctors, LLC is giving a talk entitled " Living in the Food/Pharma Matrix."  Susan Rooker will read from her new children's book Lucky Pigs.
 
Great food will be provided by our sponsor Green Elephant Vegetarian Bisto, Local Sprouts and Blue Elephant of Biddeford.
 
Music will be provided by Thom and Stacie Hanes with Mike Brown.
 
There will be numerous exhibitors, including Ashimsa Cakes, Animal Rights Maine, Arbonne, Delicious TV, Dr. Dandelion,  Farm Sanctuary, Humane Society of the United States, Institute for Humane Education, Maine Friends of Animals, Our Hen House, Peace Action Maine, Portland Food Coop, Vegetarian Resource Group, and Vine Sanctuary.
 
And don't forget the raffle!

Dedicated to the elimination of animal abuse and exploitation through education, advocacy and example.
 
 
Maine Animal Coalition
